abstract: Stock markets in the Asia-Pacific region stabilized Tuesday after a bleak day of global selling on Monday that dragged some of the world’s leading indexes – including the Dow Jones industrial index on Wall Street – sharply lower.
lead_paragraph: Stock markets in the Asia-Pacific region stabilized Tuesday after a bleak day of global selling on Monday that dragged some of the world’s leading indexes – including the Dow Jones industrial index on Wall Street – sharply lower.

headline.main: Asian Markets Are Calm a Day After a Sell-Off
